doc.after: John Sevier (23 September 1745 â 25 September 1815) was the only governor of the State of Franklin (1785â1789), the first Governor of the State of Tennessee (1796â1801 and 1803â1809), and a U.S. Congressman from Tennessee from 1811 until his death in 1815. In the American Revolutionary War he was the commander of the Washington County, Tennessee, contingent of the Overmountain Men in the Battle of Kings Mountain.
